dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 485 RH: Protecting Health Care for All Patients Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Rodgers of Washington (for herself, Mr. Smith of Missouri, Mr. Wenstrup, and Mr. Burgess) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned
Additional sponsors: Mr. Hern and Mr. Carter of Georgia
Reported from the Committee on Energy and Commerce with an amendment
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

action.action-desc: Committee on Ways and Means discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on January 24, 2023

form.official-title: To amend title XI of the Social Security Act to prohibit the use of quality-adjusted life years and similar measures in coverage and payment determinations under Federal health care programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Health Care for All Patients Act of 2023.

section.header: Prohibiting the use of quality-adjusted life years and similar measures in coverage and payment determinations under Federal health care programs

subsection.text: Section 1182(e) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320e–1(e)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting or treats extending the life of an elderly, disabled, or terminally ill individual as of lower value than extending the life of an individual who is younger, non-disabled, or not terminally ill after because of an individual’s disability;
by inserting described in the preceding sentence after such a similar measure;
by striking The Secretary shall not and inserting A Federal agency (including the CMI (as described in section 1115A)) or State may not;

by striking under title XVIII. and inserting the following: under any Federal health care program (as defined in section 1128B, except that such term shall include the health program established under chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code).; and

by adding at the end the following new sentence: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a Federal agency (including the CMI) or State may not waive the application of the provisions of this subsection (or the provisions of section 1852(o), section 1860D–12(h), section 1902(a)(88), section 1932(b)(9), or section 2102(e)) under section 1115, section 1115A, or any other demonstration or waiver authority..

subparagraph.text: Section 1902(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a(a)) is amended—

clause.text: in paragraph (86), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (87)(D), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by inserting after paragraph (87) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: provide for compliance with the requirements of section 1182(e) (relating to prohibiting the use of certain measures in coverage determinations, reimbursement, and incentive programs).

subparagraph.text: Section 1932(b) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396u–2(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on use of quality-adjusted life years
paragraph.text: The provisions of section 1182(e) shall apply to the utilization of a dollars-per-quality adjusted life year or similar measure (as described in such section) by a medicaid managed care organization under this title (or a prepaid inpatient health plan or prepaid ambulatory health plan, as defined in section 438.2 of title 42, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation), under a contract with the State) in the same manner as such provisions apply to the utilization of such a year or measure by a State under this title.
Section 2102 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397bb) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Prohibition on the use of quality-Adjusted life years and similar measures
subsection.text: A State child health plan shall provide for compliance with the requirements of section 1182(e) (relating to prohibiting the use of certain measures in coverage determinations, reimbursement, and incentive programs).

paragraph.text: Section 1852 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–22) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Prohibition on use of quality-adjusted life years
subsection.text: The provisions of section 1182(e) shall apply to the utilization of a dollars-per-quality adjusted life year or similar measure (as described in such section) by an MA plan in the same manner as such provisions apply to the utilization of such a year or measure by the Secretary under this title.

paragraph.text: Section 1860D–12 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–112) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Prohibition on use of quality-adjusted life years
subsection.text: The provisions of section 1182(e) shall apply to the utilization of a dollars-per-quality adjusted life year or similar measure (as described in such section) by a prescription drug plan in the same manner as such provisions apply to the utilization of such a year or measure by the Secretary under this title.
The amendments made by this section shall apply beginning on January 1, 2025.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported from the Committee on Energy and Commerce with an amendment
Committee on Ways and Means discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
